title: The dirtiest part of a plane
text:
The dirtiest part of a plane Article By: Megan Ellis Thu, 10 Sep 2015 2:08 PM Share Credit: pixabay.com/ Ryan McGuire 
You may be surprised to find out that the dirtiest part of the plane is not the bathroom - rather it is something much more troubling. 
Travel website Travelmath.com has revealed the results of a study that found that it is in fact the tray tables on planes which have the most germs. 
Yup, that's right - the place where you put your food. 
The study measured the amount of colony-forming units (CFU) per square inch, and the tray table was by far the worst with 2 155 CFU per square inch. 
Next is the overhead air vent, with 285 CFU per square inch. 
The lavatory flush button measured at 265 CFU per square inch while the seatbelt buckle had 230 CFU per square inch. 
The study also found that the dirtiest place in an airport is the drinking fountain buttons, with 1 240 CFU per square inch. 
All we can say is: Ewww. 
But why are tray tables dirtier that bathrooms? 
Because they are sanitised less often. 
It's best to carry hand sanitizer or some sanitary wipes with you if you want to stay clean. Related Articles
